Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: VCM administration to control rats significantly increased renal malondialdehyde ( MDA ) and urinary N - acetyl - beta - d - glucosaminidase ( NAG , a marker of renal tubular injury ) excretion but decreased superoxide dismutase ( SOD ) and catalase ( CAT ) activities .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| renal malondialdehyde (MDA) |
| urinary N - acetyl - beta - d - glucosaminidase (NAG) |
| renal tubular injury |
| superoxide dismutase (SOD) |
| catalase (CAT) |

Note: These are not diseases in the classical sense, but rather biomarkers or enzymes that are related to renal function and oxidative stress.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| renal malondialdehyde (MDA) |
| renal tubular injury |

The other mentioned entities, "urinary N - acetyl - beta - d - glucosaminidase (NAG)", "superoxide dismutase (SOD)", and "catalase (CAT)" do not clearly refer to diseases and were removed from the list.
